newsitem.title: USA: Oregon electorate to reconsider tax limits in May.
newsitem.headline: Oregon electorate to reconsider tax limits in May.

text.p: Oregon's state legislature has sent a controversial tax cutting measure back to the voters because of haggling over implementation of a similar initiative approved last November.
The new proposal -- Measure 50 -- will appear on the May 20 special election ballot, the office of Oregon's Secretary of State said on Tuesday.
If approved, it would amend portions of Measure 47.

For months, state legislators have been debating how to implement Measure 47, which rolls back property taxes by at least 10 percent and puts a cap on annual growth. Voters passed Measure 47 last November but left it up to the legislature to define how it should be implemented.

Under Measure 50, assessed values would be rolled back in 1997-1998 to 90 percent of the 1995-1996 value. Measure 50 also instructs state lawmakers to enact laws that would reduce property taxes imposed in the state by 17 percent.
